detail.content: This is the RTS frame. Note that it is 20-Byte long Control Frame. TA is the wireless unit MAC address whereas RA is the MAC address of the AP. The duration (The reservation time) is set to around 125msec which is the estimated time required to transmit the data frame (It includes time for CTS & ACK and the SIFS as well). That isRTS duration field = RTS duration = SIFS + CTS + SIFS + Data + SIFS + ACKThis is the CTS frame, and you notice it is shorter (since you don’t have to identify the transmitting MAC address (Only the AP can send the CTS). You only need to identify the receiver MAC address (either the wireless unit if unicast or all 1’s if broadcasted). The CTS duration field is not the same as that in RTS frame. It isRTS duration field = RTS duration = SIFS + Data + SIFS + ACKMost of the time, both RTS and CTS frames are unicast. The reason that it works for ALL wireless nodes is because whether the frame is addressed for a device or not, they MUST obey the duration value in the frame. How could Trudy alter the message if the message is encrypted!!Only authentication (any one could use the recipient public key) isNOTprovided.You are making the same mistake in the second question as well.
